website_summaries.verdict: A complete, top-of-the-line training system. With an extended 500-yard range and graded communication stimuli, this is one to consider if you are truly looking for the best bark collar on the market.
pros: Offers versatility for both large and small dogs and different breeds

customer_reviews.title: Lasted just one month. Save your money and look for a different brand.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware! Worked great, but does not last. My first one worked for a little over a year and then suddenly stopped, the second did the same thing just after one month. $170 down the drain, since the return window of 30 days just ended. Update: sportDOG contacted me the next day and they helped me getting it working again over the phone. So glad, because when it works it does a great job. I will test it for a couple of weeks and then upgrade my review if it keeps working.
customer_reviews.author: tina

customer_reviews.title: Will Be Returning.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for the first week. Then when took it off to charge and after that it wont work at all. No beep, not vibrate, no shock. I've tried resetting it, I've tried going step by step to program it. Nothing works. Pretty disappointing seeing how much we paid for it. The charging cables are pretty cheap too. One of them fits snugly while the other falls out. After reading some of the other reviews it seems as though the problem I'm having with this collar is pretty common.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not work at all on my dog.
customer_reviews.text: We were very disappointed in this product. Our dog didn’t respond at all to any of the different levels. We have a very old tri-tronics collar that has worked great but the charger is about to break and can no longer find a charger to fit that unit. Was really hoping the sportsdog collar would work so I spent the extra money for one day shipping because we were going on vacation with our dog and wanted it for our trip. Even with the longer prongs there was still no response to the collar. We are returning the collar. Hopefully we can find one with the same quality like our old tri-tronics one.
customer_reviews.author: mziem

customer_reviews.title: TRANSMITTER STOPPED WORKING - BEWARE OF THIS "AMAZON'S CHOICE"
customer_reviews.text: Product worked wonderfully for 1.5 month. Now the remote transmitter no longer connects with the collar. I've read & tried everything in the instructions provided. Nothing! The transmitter doesn't seem to even hold a charge. VERY VERY VERY DISAPPOINTED after this cost me $180. Part of the reason I chose this is because it was a "Amazon's Choice" and I've never had a bad experience with an ":Amazon's Choice" until now. Let's me know not to trust anything that says Amazon's Choice anymore. I should have listened to the breeder and purchased the cheap one like he has.
customer_reviews.author: Divaliscious

customer_reviews.title: Totally satisfied
customer_reviews.text: We hesitate to use this device on our Goldendoodle puppy. The package with this device arrived on time but it was put aside for over month. Our puppy started to be more and more stubborn and simply didn't listening when we call him. It started to be dangerous when he ran on the street or played with other dogs. We started obedient training using this device. Our puppy is like an angel. He comes right after we call him or stop running away when we call him to return. Highly recommend this device. You won't be disappointed if you follow the instructions and watch YouTube video on how to train your dog using this device.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Great system, very effective until stopped working...
customer_reviews.text: This remote collar WAS great, but after 3.5 months of use the vibrate and shock buttons stopped working. Now only the beep works... we mostly used the beep and vibrate options, which worked really well. However, occasionally a low shock was needed. Now the collar is essentially ineffective because my dog has learned that it only beeps. Instead of listening/ minding right away as before, she ignores the beep and misbehaves much more. I miss the fully functional collar. Looking to get replacement since it is still under warranty and I purchased the “insurance”.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: We have had this shock collar for two years, at first it worked great but slowly I started to wonder if it was working because my dog wasn't responding to the shocks, even on higher levels. Now 2 years later it has stopped even beeping when I try to do the "tone" button. Disappointed this was so inconsistent and didn't last longer given how expensive it was.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: incredible for my Saluki mix
customer_reviews.text: I have a 7 month old Saluki/Whippet mix that I didn't think I"d ever trust off leash. If you follow the very clear instructions, if your dog is intelligent this is indispensible. I hike with my dogs every day about 4 miles, often off leash. Now she hears the tone and immediately looks to me for a hand signal. If she doesn't come right away, one vibrations is usually all it takes. When chasing birds or gophers, a shock at a 3 is all it takes. I shocked myself at a 7 and felt very comfortable using this unit. She's so confident now I can't believe she's the same dog. Couldn't recommend it more, especially for a sighthound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is second receiver I have lost because of poor quality connecting receiver to rope
customer_reviews.text: Little plastic clip to hold receiver is the poorest idea I have ever seen the old clip was metal attached to rope around neck. Plastic clip and string already broke what a joke. This is second receiver I have lost because of poor quality connecting receiver to rope. Not very happy when you pay $180 a crack
customer_reviews.author: FUUBAR!

customer_reviews.title: puppy listens to me now!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that didn't cost a fortune, worked reliably, and had several low settings. I just wanted to get a puppy's attention, not ruin him with a punishing jolt. I had a cheap one years ago with another dog that seemed to give a shock when I didn't want it too. This one has not malfunctioned. I just used the very lowest setting and he thinks I can touch him at a distance without hurting him. The tone reminds him. So far it's been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: lepdog

customer_reviews.title: She focuses better on our walks with the noise correction if needed
customer_reviews.text: This is outstanding! My dog stops barking at the neighbor dog now with only the beep to interrupt her. It really only took a few times of using the vibration with vocal corrections and two shocks for her to figure out to listen to the beep. She used to fight through the fence with the neighbor dog and come back inside with a bloodied muzzle from scratching it up on the fencing. She focuses better on our walks with the noise correction if needed. I was able to have her outside with me all afternoon gardening with no issues going after the neighbor's dog who was, as always, outside. I am beyond pleased with it!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Perez

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this system in late 2018. The collar battery failed late 2020. A call to Sportdog and a new battery was on the way ( I purchased the replacement battery) but it turned out that there was an issue with the collar unit itself. Even though it was out of warranty they took into account that I'd talked with their service tech who diagnosed the problem as the battery and they sent me an entire new unit....now that is GOOD customer Service. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: William J Herrick

customer_reviews.title: Poor product life span, non-existant support.
customer_reviews.text: After 1.5 yr, the collar/receiver failed with a solid red light when the stimulation button was pressed. I replaced the battery, reset the collar and the product fails still. Support is not reachable. The support website said phone and live chat available Saturdays from 9-5 ET. I tried live chat to no avail. I called support and either got a busy signal or a recording saying the system was down and to try back when it the system was available. I can't recommend this product based on the support and short-life of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Orion940

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 neither one vibrates
customer_reviews.text: Not too happy with purchase. I would have returned them but packaging got thrown away and collars were cut to fit. Neither of the two units vibrate as the ad stated they would have tone, vibrate and static shock. The Tone is non adjustable for volume and kind of weak but the dogs do respond to it. have only had to use the low setting and up to #3 to REALLY get there attention. They know now after a few days that 3 quick tones are a warning. One tone now and they come running and sit. System does work IF you work with your dogs, it is not a punishment device and a good aide for training.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper502

customer_reviews.title: It shocks.... No beep option
customer_reviews.text: Excellent customer service. It was very complicated to set up, and required 2 calls. Both times they were helpful, and resolved my issues. It Shocks! My biggest issue with this collar is there is no beep option. There are 3 levels of shock. I hate to shock my boy every time, and wish there were a beep, or vibrate mode. The lowest setting makes him yelp. Breaking my heart to shock him all the time with no other way to correct.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable brand, would totally recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand. We actually purchased this as we just got another dog and wanted another collar (not shared remotes). Our new pup snuck into a room she’s not supposed to be in and completely destroyed the charger for our older collar, so we got this one and thought this would be great - we got another charger with it and could swap the collars and remotes on it. We were wrong. The chargers are not the same. We will still try to find a new charger though!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Corrects a big dog on the spot!
customer_reviews.text: Our 83 pound 9 month old Labradoodle was developing some bad habits (chasing or lunging at cars when walking off our property) which were not easily correctable. Then we got the SportDog Field Trainer! He responded with the tone, but really stopped his bad behavior with the dial set on 2. Now I just put the Remote in my pocket and show it to him and he stops! It's been to cold for him to be in water so we don't know how waterproof it is, but we're confident it will be as reliable as the rest of the package.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS COLLAR NOW!!
customer_reviews.text: STOP READING REVIEWS AND BUY THIS COLLAR NOW!!, seriously love this collar, adopted a stray off the street and with the help of this collar and proper training she is a different dog completely, must add that I almost never use the electric stimulus, and she responds to the Beep and Vibrate function extremely well, I have also used a single remote with multiple collars works very well. Had the collar for two years before the side button fell off, was able to superglue the button back on and change the button configuration read the manual its very easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, wish it had more tone/vibration options
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased because the collar unit is small, light, and I was looking for something reliable with both vibration mode and tone. It charges fast - just takes a couple of hours - and it lasts for several weeks if not used very much. I do wish this collar had different vibration levels and multiple tones/volumes. I also wish it had shorter, nubby prongs as both sets provided in the box are pretty pointed (no different from other collars I've looked at, though). Both tone and vibration seem to work fine over long distance in open areas at night when your dog gets too far away.
customer_reviews.author: Traleah

customer_reviews.title: Very effective training tool
customer_reviews.text: I have a young dog who will run into traffic after squirrels, balls etc. If it will run, he will chase it. After using the collar he will stop short of the street at the edge of our lot and not enter the street so long as he is aware of where he is. It has been a big help to us and we did not have to use it much. The vibration did not get his attention but the shock sure did. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Ohsweethome

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good...
customer_reviews.text: We were using one of the "choice" $40 units for a couple of years, but it kept breaking, so we decided to pay the extra to get a better unit. This is definitely a better unit, much more solid, and really waterproof. The problem is the instructions are not clear... I still don't know how to make it just vibrate, or maybe our unit is defective, but I can't tell... It is not bothering me too much though, as I can set the shock low or high to get my dogs attention. The shock collar has been worth it's weight in gold for us and our 80lb Staffie. I hope this unit keeps working... so far, so good :)
customer_reviews.author: Lincoln A. Kroll

customer_reviews.title: This is our second one of these.
customer_reviews.text: Work great we have two dog's an Alaskan Malamute (140 lbs.) and a Black Lab. The Malamute is 9 years old and was introduced to the collar when he was bout 1 year of age. When he alerts to another dog, animal or person you could not break his focus to listen to commands. With in about a week of using the collar on him, he responded to voice commands about 80% of the time and the tone option if the voice command does not work. He now responds to voice commands about 99.9% of the time and tone the rest. I works great with the Black Lab when he is in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur B. Titcomb III

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have
customer_reviews.text: Wow is this thing awesome! Have yet to find a problem with this remote trainer. My dog loves seeing this come out because she knows we are going to go have some fun! When used properly this a great tool to have at your fingertips. Is very easy to adjust strength. I did learn that if you spray the heavy duty bug spray and get some on it the matte coating on it starts to flake off - I don't care what it looks like just that it works. The charger is kind of strange as it does not have a solid connection so it will easily fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: OMG!!! If you need a trainer for your dog you found one!!! Love this product. My golden puppy was a terrible Walker and hated leash. He jerked my husband very hard one time when saw squirrel. My husband injured his knee. Enough was enough. I saw this trainer, read the reviews and placed an order. Two days later!!!!! What a nice dog to walk with now!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tati

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: I don't know where I'd be without this trainer. Our Small Munsterlander responds to it perfectly in the field, park, running next to our bikes, etc. We use it everywhere. She responds just fine to the low settings, and knows as soon as I click it's time to come back to heel. Works great when she's locked onto a scent at the park that may lead her too close to the road. Quick zap and she comes right back. I had an issue with my remote early on and SportDog customer service was extremely helpful through the process. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Must move dial to change button function
customer_reviews.text: Works well for getting dog to listen. The dial must be turned to go from tone to stimulate. It would be nice if one button was tone, one button was vibrate and one button was stimulation and there was a dial for intensity of each. All in all, it works well. This model only has tone and stimulation. After a little practice you get proficient with one hand operation but it takes a bit. Only needed stimulation 2 or 3 times and now it is just the tone function we use. The collar must be pretty snug to get the prongs to pass the shock.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again!
customer_reviews.text: I think the collar battery is my fault! This thing has become a staple before my dog can go out. He knows he needs his fancy clothes on before he can leave the house. He now knows after 2 weeks of use that all we have to do is show him the remote and he behaves. Customer service on this collar is amazing. I voiced my concern about battery life and the company said they will replace the battery. They also send the kit to change the battery. I am VERY pleased
customer_reviews.author: Pixie Otter

customer_reviews.title: Quality collar
customer_reviews.text: I tried several of the lower-priced e-collars for my English shepherd mix, Rudy, and ended up returning them--they either stopped working or weren't effective. I've had a better experience with this collar. I do have to use it on a high setting to get a result, and you have to make sure it's on tight. Even so, it occasionally doesn't seem to work--might have to do with my dog? On the plus side, I can use this several times without it losing its charge, and it charges quickly. Overall, a positive experience.
customer_reviews.author: AJP

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Our labradoodle has done very well with this! No more barking AT ALL in his crate or acting a fool at the door. It does require frequent charging. 24 hours is about as good as we get. I do recommend making sure you’re properly trained to use it before putting it on your pet. We were and have had zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mindi P

customer_reviews.title: Gets their attention
customer_reviews.text: I have two 18 month old border collies. Very energetic and very interested in chasing (or herding) anything that moves. Including the trucks and tractors that zoom by our house. Not good. These collars have a beep, a buzz and a zap function. They pretty much ignore the beep and the buzz. However, even on 2 (out of 7) they pay attention to the zap. I tried 3 and 4 out on my hand and it's a pretty good zot. I can't imagine the blockhead dog that would need #7. Anyway, my dogs now come when I call them and seldom need a zap. I haven't checked the range out to 500 yds but 200 yds works fine. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: McDaniken

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this remote trainer, it is just what I needed. I have had other brands and they were just not as dependable as this one. It can be set according to your dogs temperment, mine is set for stubborn dog as my rottie is very stubborn, this works very well for him. I don't like led screens on my remote and this fits the bill for me. some people might find it difficult to operate but if you take your time and read the instructions carefully it is fairly easy. I would definitely recommend this product and would buy it again if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Iris

customer_reviews.title: Collar and training manual are fantasic.
customer_reviews.text: This collar is really good. I have a GPS. As long as the collar is tight it maintains a good connection and works every time. It falls down around the front his throat about 30% of the time. I LOVE the training manual it comes with. I have read many dog training books and this had many gems that I had never heard before. It is almost more about training YOU than your dog. It is an honest and crucial component to training your dog with this collar and I'm very inpressed with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brays

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It is long range, very easy to adjust (you owe it to your dog to shock yourself) the sensitivity of the shock. I tried it at 4 and it was plenty for me to not want it again. My dog learned quickly and has not needed further correction. I’m grateful I spent more for this product vs cheaper versions. It’s a game changed if your responsibility using it and follow the rules do it’s not confusing to the dog. Would recommend 1000000.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Campion

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: By far the best dog corrector I have tired on my husky! She is very stubborn, would just look at me with a bored face when I issued a command. She is highly treat motivated so when that was not apart of the equation you could forget her doing anything. She also pulled very hard on walks. I bought this shocker and use it only when she is ignoring a command. She is smart in that her attitude changes to more submissive when the shocker is on. Definitely recommend for the more stubborn breads.
customer_reviews.author: Mari Kigz

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item after purchasing a less expensive item that didn't work. I was really hesitant to spend the money but this product was worth every penny. I have a foxhound and she likes to follow her nose. I did take her through a 9 week obedience call but I needed something to remind her to come when she was out of ear shot. I hardly ever have to put it beyond vibrate.
customer_reviews.author: Jacque Osborn

customer_reviews.title: 2.5 stars read review
customer_reviews.text: I really expected more and even returned the first unit due to it kept unpairing from collar. I can use it at a 4 for one dog. The young hound doesn't flinch at a 7 and a few times of using the 'pop' kills the battery and not sure I'd trust it more than about 50' out. Really pretty disappointed in this unit. 2.5 stars
customer_reviews.author: tz

customer_reviews.title: The BEST for large dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Tried a less expensive brand - did not work on my 1 yr old, 100 lb doberman pup. THIS WORKS! He has really changed his attitude while wearing this. I still put on him every day that we are out on the property, and on occasion have to "remind" him with the tone. He minds SO MUCH better now! Thank you! At his size, it will be very important to be in control of him. Now I don't worry about that.
customer_reviews.author: dobiegirls

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a fan of "shock collars" but our German Shepherd was just so stubborned NOTHING worked. She would bark bark bark bark and bark some more and no amount of training helped. In a desperate search I resorted to ordering this, it does not hurt her, it just gets her attention. If I have to go higher on the "buz" scale it just makes her stop barking, no yelping from pain. This has saved my life and she is more relaxed and a happy dog and we are a happy family (along with our neighbors)! If you have a barking problem this is your answer...look no further!
customer_reviews.author: Gina Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great training collar, but maybe not top of the line...
customer_reviews.text: We used this for a German Shorthair who never quite learned to walk on a leash. It worked great for many years, but the side button on the remote fell off after about 3 years. Also the matte coating on the remote started peeling off around the same time. I bought this thinking it was the top of the line (it was one of the more expensive ones) but not sure the quality really stood up to that. It worked great for many years (still works today!) just had a few issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer!
customer_reviews.text: This collar has been a real game changer with two stubborn pups. Life is so much easier having two pups that listen and stay in the yard. Rarely have to use the shock, the bell is enough to have them come running from anywhere in our large yard. We never thought we’d be able to have them both outside at one time, let alone without being on a leash.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Bad charge design
customer_reviews.text: I have a bully breed. I get some results training with this. My biggest gripe is it doesn't charge easily. The charging plugs are very loose and the slightest bump on the table it sits on causes the charging to stop. FRUSTRATED!! I may get better results if I fully charge it
customer_reviews.author: Alyce

customer_reviews.title: No vibration?
customer_reviews.text: So I bought these and didnt feel a vibration so i exchanged it for another one. turns out that there is NO VIBRATION for this collar. i think the "vibration" they are talking about is the low level shock on setting 1. The collar does not vibrate!! I have had collars that actually have a vibration, this isnt one. there is no vibration. non whatsover. on the dial for the remote it says V/T which one would assume meant Vibrate/Tone. well its only a tone. then from there it goes from level 1-7. no vibration. wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Training
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my beagle. He becomes distracted easily, and if he focuses in on something, he will forego listening and run after whatever he sets his mind too. I was afraid for his safety if he would slip off leash, so I added this device while walking along with a gentle lead. I like that you can adjust the level. This works well on the lower levels -- it gives him just enough to snap his attention back to me to listen. These days, I do not even have to turn it on -- he knows when the collar is on that he must be on his best behavior!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Burke

customer_reviews.title: My adult son bought to help train his rescue great dane. This 2 year old canine is on ...
customer_reviews.text: My adult son bought to help train his rescue great dane. This 2 year old canine is on his 3rd owner, I'm guessing because of training issues. He is coming along amazingly well, we now compare him to a large, over-sized cat. The actual shock feature was only used a couple of times, he now responds immediately to the sound the collar emmits. My 14 year old son can now walk the great dane off leash.
customer_reviews.author: M. Foster

customer_reviews.title: High end user friendly (human and dog product)
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike. I did need assist in reducing the settings for my 10 month old goldendoodle. The staff at SportDOG are competent and very nice. My dog and I run free in the trails of Colorado and I want her in sight and coming back to me with one command. Mostly, I use tone. When she sees people or dogs she knows she needs to be corrected with vibrate and occasionally a shock. (It happens. ) We've had this three days and I am greatly relieved to not be calling for her.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth cramer

customer_reviews.title: We use primarily the vibration and a #2 shock when she is super fixated on the hose or a tennis ball
customer_reviews.text: So far this has worked really well for our 70 lb amstaff. She gets very fixated on objects and it works very well on land, but she likes to dive down into ponds and attack hoses and the shock feature is far less effective in the water. We use primarily the vibration and a #2 shock when she is super fixated on the hose or a tennis ball. Totally stands up to wear and tear, it's been covered in mud and poop and washes off nicely. Battery is lasting a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: lsr

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I use this when I take my dog for walks because he can become aggressive with other dogs - I generally use the vibration mode - every once in a while I have used it on the 1st level (zap). It is really great - but my dog is very stubborn so I need more practice on how to use the e-collar better. My only disappointment is the battery life - I feel it finishes quickly - but by the same token - it recharges within 2hours. So I am ok with that.
customer_reviews.author: ladyM

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product! Worth EVERY penny!
customer_reviews.text: This product was the best purchase I have made for my dog. I have a 16lb Shih Tzu / Maltese mix who is a very good dog but this breed is VERY stubborn. I wanted off leash training along with bark correction and this product has completely changed my dog from a little pest to a very happy and well behaved dog. For anyone who thinks this is an inhumane route to go for your dog you could not be more wrong. It does not hurt the dog (and mine is small!). My dog also runs over to put it on. He loves his collar!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Schneck

customer_reviews.title: Faulty right from the start
customer_reviews.text: I tried to charge the 2 components as instructed upon receipt. The cheesy little plugs on the plug-in charger would not fit into the receiver component. I looked at other dog training collars for lower cost but decided to spring for the more costly one hoping that it will last for a while. Amazon will allow me to return and exchange for a new one. I hope that when that one arrives its better otherwise the less expensive ones might be better.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry McBride

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: The battery life on my unit was never good and now it won't take a charge at all (less than 2 years old), will try to repair and update this review. The range on the unit also leaves much to be desired compared to other units at its price point.
customer_reviews.author: DIYIndependence

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I hated the idea of using a shock collar but have had to for a few problems that a leash pop or treats couldn't resolve. I like that it has a bunch of levels and I rarely have needed to go above a 2. The behavioral problems have abated considerably and I expect will be completely resolved soon. Again, i hated to use it, and do so sparingly but it works and if used correctly can be a valuable tool.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Severse

customer_reviews.title: stopped working in less than 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: it worked well until 2 days ago, suddenly stopped working. it shocks when you try it on your hand but when is around the dog's neck, it sends a very weak signal even at the highest , dog doesn'teven flinch. we called the tech support but it was no help, the "expert" had no idea what the problem was, he kept reading from the manual. We did the reset, no use. And since the return window is closed, this happened after 30 days of the purchase, I can't return it. I need a refund.
customer_reviews.author: ahsen tatar

customer_reviews.title: If you follow the training you will have a world class dog
customer_reviews.text: Paid for itself the very first time I used it by keeping my dog from running in the street. Do yourself one HUGE favor and watch the video then follow it word for word. If I hadn't watched the video I would have trained my dog backwards. In just two weeks I can now take him over two miles without a leash. He sees other dogs, water, rabbits, and birds but won't break from me. Do the training for yourself then you can train the dog and it is magic.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: I'm not too impressed
customer_reviews.text: My dog reacted way better with the yard trainer than this one. I plan to return and get the yard trainer again.. This one completely sucks! I have to turn it all the way the 5 to get my dog to have a small reaction to it and he doesn't even listen with that one if I turn the 6 it hurts him which makes no sense. This model is completely awful
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended, well made product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! My german shepherd is not a hunting dog, but she loves to swim in the lake. We're on 20 acres and she roams free. Using the sound alone gets her running back home. We did training at first with vibration and an occasional nic. We waited until she was over a 1 1/2 yrs old to train/use the e-collar. She's 7 now, and we just purchased her 3rd collar. We use it year round. I did love the pink camo, but unfortunately it's been discontinued. Only drawback is that the entire unit is black, transmitter & collar. Our gsd is black as well. I ordered a bright green collar to make it easier to see & use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this product to train their dog for hunting or ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised how fast the sportdog collar worked on my Jack Russell. He was very hard headed and would take off any chance he could. After watching the videos that comes with the collar I started working with the dog. Only two days of training he listened to all commands and didnt try to chase birds,dogs, or rabbits. I would recommend this product to train their dog for hunting or just for around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C.

customer_reviews.title: When you're done doing 100% training and its not working.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tool for correcting bad behavior. My 6 month old Doberman was digging up every square inch of the yard. I set it on vibrate and just hid, waiting for him to start. Now he thinks holes bite. I tried it on myself and it doesn't hurt at all.
customer_reviews.author: the forgottenfootNJ

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: On my 3rd remote now.
customer_reviews.text: This collar works great for about a year and then the remote will only transmit a few feet. Customer service is great, but I don't like the fact that I have gone through now THREE remotes with the same problem. In contrast, I remembered a 20 year old TriTonics Sport 60 from my previous dog that had been in the closet for at least 10 years, battery completely spent. I charged it overnight and it works flawlessly, 20 years later. TWENTY years! With a battery that had been dead for at least 10 of those years! So don't waste your money. Get one that will last.
customer_reviews.author: KFG in KCMO

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It's not the fanciest one for sure, and if you have more than one collar for it, you lose either the tone or the vibrate (your choice). But, the battery life is decent. I charge them every couple/few days. I have not tested it for distance beyond 100' or so, so I can't attest to the range. It's simple, and I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Harmon

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing! If you r on the fence just do ...
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing! If you r on the fence just do it! My pup is very independent he is a one year old and easily distracted, 14lb Jack Russel mix. I have had this collar for 3 months now the battery last me over 2 weeks before I charge it. I can now have my pup off leashe no worries I hit the button that beeps and he knows that means to come by my side I never have to use the shock just the sound and then a vibrate if he is being extra stubborn it is amazing! I recommend this to anyone and would buy it again in a heart beat!
customer_reviews.author: B Free

customer_reviews.title: I have had this for months with no issues
customer_reviews.text: I went through a couple of different trainers before finding this one. My golden retriever has this on in water, has rubbed it against rocks and has yet to break it like cheaper brands. You get what you pay for and this is worth the money. I waited till I owned the product long enough to say it does hold up and the multiple options for training between sound, vibrate and different levels of zapping have worked great and now for the most part I just need the beep most of the time if he needs a reminder.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product! No more runaway!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect! Trained my runaway dog in 1 week! She can run in the fields and parks now and always returns to me! So glad for this! Now my dog can enjoy being outside with me! Only had to use the shock on 1 setting one time! Always use the vibrate mode when needed!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great Collar that will LAST!
customer_reviews.text: Great training collar. I have used Sport Dog for years. My last collar lasted me 7 years. This one offers an audible "Beep" as well as vibrate. It does have 7 levels of shock. It has multiple configurations you can set for the remote. Love that you can select Tone/Vibrate only.
customer_reviews.author: krazydaze

customer_reviews.title: Woks well
customer_reviews.text: I used this to train my lab, who was very enthusiastic and hard headed. She now walks off lead and without this collar. It made us both very happy, in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Reiss

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: this is the second one I purchased, previous brand only worked twice. This one is sturdy, fits well and my dog responded immediately. The batteries charge fully within 2hrs. We only use it in certain circumstances so the charge lasts for over a week. The remote is a great size. Very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: For Serious Training
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT easy to use and requires a lot of time and dedication to understanding the manual and time with your dog. I returned it because this is not a product for a layperson like me. This product is clearly targeted at sporting dogs. Very well made product, but I wanted to write this cautionary review.
customer_reviews.author: ssstephanie

customer_reviews.title: loved this collar until it died - 18 days short of 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I will start out by saying that I absolutely LOVE everything about this collar. It was extremely effective and allowed my dog to run in the fields behind my house. However, it's been 18 days short of a year and the collar will no longer take a charge and I am forced to buy another collar. I think that it's too expensive to have to buy a new one every year.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Great priced and works better than others in price range.
customer_reviews.text: Works great - simple to use compared to other products I have owned. I have used two other products (PetTech and generic). PetTech had 100 levels of sensitivity which was way too much to mess with and most did not work on my 7 month old bulldog/mastiff. The SportDog brand worked awesomely. 7 levels low - Tick and medium - continuous. Plus it had tone. The buttons are placed great unlike other brands that can be pressed by accident. Not SportDog - it has been great and honestly now I just grab the collar and he starts to behave!!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works well
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Wish there were more options for use with two dogs but I still prefer this layout to the Garmin and other brands I looked at. Very strong.
customer_reviews.author: gaterose

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have a very energetic independent Yellow Lab, he has a mind of his own and needs reminding sometimes. This collar is great, we have never had to use the shock setting, just the vibration and tone. I take him running and swimming several days a week and he knows when we put this collar on he gets to go play, so it's not an adverse thing. He actually like the collar cause he knows it means fun is coming.
customer_reviews.author: RiverRunRusticWoodCrafts

customer_reviews.title: Infinitely useful and essential
customer_reviews.text: We love sportdog collar. This is the second collar we have purchased and used. It’s an every day necessity, as we don’t have a fenced in yard for our dog. Training with it is super easy, and we don’t have to shock very often because our dog sticks around. Collar is reliable and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a week
customer_reviews.text: This review is long over due. I'm very disappointed in this product. I ordered this brand due to its reputation and the fact I could add a total of 3 dollars to the one remote. Within a week one of the buttons on the remote stopped working and one of the chargers wont charge the device. This is frustrating because these arnt cheap and I work on a ranch so I need them to assist in controlling the dogs while herding animals. Otherwise when it works it works well just not very well made
customer_reviews.author: jake

customer_reviews.title: Best dog training collar I’ve ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had other training collars. This one works. It works months later. The last two brands I tried didn’t last two months. This is one however is still going and works from a distance. Dog gets in water and no issues. I’d recommend this to anyone who has a stubborn dog or a puppy who is too excited.
customer_reviews.author: JAinATX

customer_reviews.title: This is complicated to use correctly and the battery is not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: This is a very elite and expensive product and it should be easier to use it successfully. We read through the instructions several times, have followed the instructions as we best understand them and yet we are able to get this to work correctly about 60% of the time. I am sure that if you know how to use this devise it is just wonderful. We don't. It isn't. Interesting that one of the criteria that Amazon generates to rate this product is not "Ease of use"
customer_reviews.author: Caprika6

customer_reviews.title: Works great on very stubborn large dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I have used shock collars in the past by this company and they are worth every penny. In fact, once I accidentally left the remote laying on the arm of my lawn chair and went inside for something. When I came back my Rottie was chewing on it. It was pretty mauled and I figured well there goes that one, when in fact it still worked great!! Great quality, worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome collar and service!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this collar and the extra one for our two Rotties, the one that came with the remote broke after a month, and I’m thinking Oh Boy this is going to be a pain.... turns out Sport Dog has the BEST customer service I’ve ever had to deal with Hands Down! They shipped a new collar without any fuss!! Works awesome!! Will definitely purchase for this company every time!!
customer_reviews.author: Mishell Whisman

customer_reviews.title: Best Dog Training Tool!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! My dog was totally out of control - barking, digging holes, chewing whatever he could steal. I've only had this a short time and I rarely have to hit a button anymore. I just say no and show him the remote and he behaves. Well worth every penny I spent on this!
customer_reviews.author: Michele Clary

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased, good for energetic lab
customer_reviews.text: Works very well on our lab when we have her outdoors. It is important to follow the instructions for getting your dog familiar with the collar. Our lab actually enjoys putting it on as she knows that we are going somewhere that she will enjoy. The vibration does nothing for our lab and she has a very high pain tolerance, but the static stimulation and tone are very effective when used properly and responsibly.
customer_reviews.author: Peter S.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for, and this is what I've needed for a while
customer_reviews.text: Works like you would expect, does the job of getting my very stubborn pups attention without hesitation. I usually keep it around 2-3 but up to 5 during high intensity situations (other dogs, outdoor creatures, cars, etc). Remote never sleeps like some other brands and is smaller so it fits in the palm of your hand perfectly. Recharge both the remote and collar at the same time and usually get ~3-4 days between charges using daily right now. Definitely worth the price if your pup has trouble listening.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: This is my second SportDog collar, first one bought ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second SportDog collar, first one bought 10 years ago, and that one is still working. Make no mistake, you get what you pay for. SportDog is the premiere name in eCollars for a reason: They perform. I use these collars to pheasant hunt behind my flushing Springer Spaniels. I put the collars on and don't even need to carry the remote anymore, they know what the deal is. I've shot hundreds of birds over these collars, all wild birds, not one is penned raised.
customer_reviews.author: B. Schulte

customer_reviews.title: This works well without negative reinforcements.
customer_reviews.text: I like how the remote has a wide range from mild to strong as far as vibration. And even the lowest vibration has an option for mild/strong. This really helps our pup pay attention when he is distracted. The battery life seems to last a long time which is awesome. This is way better than a shock collar. We are against those types of reinforcements.
customer_reviews.author: LaineTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Expensive. WORTH IT.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what vibration strength is on there for... since I only know how to shock and beep the dog. It works well, after a few warning beeps I zapped him and now he listens to the beeping really well. The 3 high is the setting I go for if he is misbehaving. A 7 high if he does not listen mid-sprint toward something he shouldn’t be running toward. Thanks to this collar he can run around on hikes much better... without a leash.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Works great on the farm and at great distance
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is works as advertised. My only complaint is the collar is made for very large dogs but we just fold back over on itself. We have a new 6 mo boxer puppy. He can be very hard headed and living out in the country we want him to run free in the yard. He is learning, but still will push boundaries. The collar is a gentle reminder and brings him back into order. Would purchase again!!
customer_reviews.author: cowdoc

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for my stubborn dog!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 6 year old lab/coonhound mix who has always struggled to stay close by when off a leash (she’s a runner 😒) this collar has been so useful in training her to stay close to me while off her leash! I’ve tried cheaper versions but this has been the only one that’s worked so far!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Ketchum

customer_reviews.title: Unruly to obedient in 30 minutes. great product
customer_reviews.text: Unruly and just out of reach to obedient in 30 minutes. Our Sheppard was 1,000% puppy, but this device changes him within minutes. Suddenly he found himself no longer able to stay out of reach, and his recall improved substantially. He swims with this on daily, and it hasn't failed yet. Make sure, after you put it on the dog, that you move it up and down against their skin so it makes contact. If you don't, it may sit on the fur and become ineffective. Has made a puppy into an amazing dog.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: PEACE AT LAST!
customer_reviews.text: I can now sit peacefully on my patio and read my book and throw the ball for my 10 yr. old dog Bella without having her barking at me or making ME get up to get the ball she dropped 8 feet away. She brings it right to me...no barking and we are both soooo much happier! Thank you Sport Dog! Very little correction needed...she caught on within 10 minutes and we are BOTH SO HAPPY NOW! Looking forward to the rest of my peaceful summer! 😊😊😊🤗😎
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good value for buck
customer_reviews.text: Great collar for the most part. Only thing I don’t like is the fact that my controller is finicky. If you don’t have it exactly on a number it won’t shock the dog. Meaning if it’s 1/1000th of an inch off, it won’t buzz so it’s super sensitive. Other than that, great buy
customer_reviews.author: cheyenne farris

customer_reviews.title: Best Training Collar ever!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product!!! And what's better, each time I had questions about the device, all I had to do is call up customer service. They're so knowledgeable, and readily HELPFUL and FRIENDLY I'd buy another product from them without thinking.
customer_reviews.author: teadrinker

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again if we ever get another dog
customer_reviews.text: We love using this on our dog, we rarely need to put it on a shock setting but if we do a 1 or 2 works perfectly. Our dog has learnt many commands with just the beeps (one beep for fetch, two beeps for come etc) We did have to cut the collar down though because it was far too long.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Life changer!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very active Jack Russell who is an excellent dog but just wouldn’t listen. This collar has changed our lives! I only use the tone as a reminder to him to come when called and it works like a charm. As soon as I put the collar on him, he is like a different dog! He can now go outside unleashed- he loves the extra freedom and I love not having to chase him around the neighborhood!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second sport dog. I bought one when my pup was 10 weeks old and it wore out. But did a great job for the 3 years I used it with no problems. So that's why I have bought another one to continue using when my lab may need correcting which isn't often.
customer_reviews.author: William Deal

customer_reviews.title: Top choice for helping our dog be a better house companion
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this purchase. Reliable, slim, sturdy, with a lot of flexibility. Read manual and test it on yourself first so you know what your dog is experiencing. It allowed our dog to become a better house companion when earlier it looked hopeless that he would ever be responsible in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  Works Great!  Light Weight Collar and Remote!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Works Great! Light Weight Collar and Remote! I love the range of adjustment. I use it on "1" which I cannot even feel but it (gently) gets my dogs attention. I love the additional two push buttons that increase the strength without having to look down to dial up to a higher setting.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Use it a lot when we're hiking and very happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Dog only needed to be zapped once to learn a command. Tone is all he needs now once called. Battery on collar doesn't last as long as collars with replaceable batteries, but definitely easy to charge. Use it a lot when we're hiking and very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Bad battery, overall it’s a OK e collar.. not worth the month though
customer_reviews.text: I received the e collar yesterday, fast shipping. Overall the collar is good. Unfortunately the battery is bad in the collar it took 3 hours to charge and died in less than a hour in training. The manual is extremely confusing and i have contacted the company to change the mods. Vibration and tone are random through the dial intensity. I honestly don’t think it’s worth 159.00 to be honest....
customer_reviews.author: Destiny Davis

customer_reviews.title: ... that much I needed help in breaking a couple bad habits that I felt I tried everything to break ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't use it that much I needed help in breaking a couple bad habits that I felt I tried everything to break them but seemed to failed. But I used this two times and that pretty much stopped the unwanted behavior. Love all the settings.. I now wish I would have bought the complete unit with the yard fencing. It sounds like it would have worked much better than the unit I already purchased. My unit gives no warning sound, which is a feature I do not like at all.
customer_reviews.author: Earl K.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Some collars will try and impress you with settings from 1 to 100. Kind of reminds me of Nigel's amp going to 11 in the movie Spinal Tap. This one doesn't need gimmicks. It runs from 1 to 7 and we've never had to move past 2. The range is as advertised, it's seems to be waterproof, and so far the quality seems top notch.
customer_reviews.author: zoy

customer_reviews.title: Love SportDog!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second collar I have purchased. (I have the SD-425 for my dog, and I purchased this for my mother's dog.) These collars saved my sanity. I have a 75lb dog that turns into a pogo stick around guests. This does the trick to correct his negative behavior, and I couldn't even tell you where his leash is anymore. We started training with mild correction, and now he just gets beeped, and that is all it takes. Amazing product, amazing information included with purchase. I also purchased the SportDog bark collar, you won't find me buying any other brand!
customer_reviews.author: B. Hollaender

customer_reviews.title: For a $170 I expected more in terms of battery life (Updated).
customer_reviews.text: Collar worked great when purchased in July 2018. As of March 2019 the battery life is only around 3 - 4 hours. It's become very unreliable. So this product will last less than a year. I've contacted customer support so will update my review then. As of now... 2 stars. UPDATE: I reached out to customer service and they were able to replace the battery under warranty. I'm updating my review to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: KJamesJR

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product/ wont keep a charge
customer_reviews.text: This collar does not work. We charged it when we got it for 6 hours It stayed charged for 5 mins. My dog stopped responding after we beeped it one time. (Out Australian cattle dog is already trained on a collar) So I checked it and the collar was dead. I charged it again 7 to 10 hours, Collar worked great while I tested it. 5 mins later , collar was dead. Contacted sport dog they told me to contact seller that they do lot support their product unless you purchase it direct from them. I highly reccomend avoiding this product and company.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

product_meta.title: SportDOG Brand 425X Remote Trainers - 500 Yard Range E-Collar with Static, Vibrate and Tone - Waterproof, Rechargeable
product_meta.description: Size:E-Collar| Style:Original (Old Version)The FieldTrainer 425 takes the most advanced, industry-leading technology that SportDOG Brand has ever built into its e-collars and packaged it up in the most compact system ever offered. Ideal for training in the yard or field, or for hunting with close-working dogs, the SD-425 allows you to switch instantly between 7 levels of low/medium stimulation, as well as train with vibration and tone.
feature_bullets: E-collar that features 500 yard range and can be used to train 3 dogs with the same Remote Transmitter with purchase of additional Add-A-Dog Collars (SDR-AF); Collar Receiver fits dogs 8 pounds or larger with neck sizes 5" - 22"

The Remote Transmitter's dial allows you to instantly select one of the 7 levels of static stimulation in low or medium ranges while the buttons allow you to deliver your choice of momentary (nick) or continuous stimulation. You also have the option to train with vibration (buzz) and tone (beep)
Both the Remote Transmitter and Collar Receiver feature our DryTek technology making them waterproof and submersible to 25 feet

Rechargeable lithium-ion batteries charge in 2 hours and last 50-70 hours per charge; The Remote Transmitter and Collar Receiver both feature a low battery indicator and can be charged at the same time using the included split-end charger
Remote Transmitter button functions can be customized; Detailed operating guide, training DVD, and a locally based Customer Care Center, available 6 days a week, provide support when you need it

By designing our products in the field, with heat, cold, rain, snow, dust, mud, and wind in mind, SportDOG has become the most recognized brand in the electronic tracking and training categories, making the promise to always create "Gear The Way You'd Design It"

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
